page.title: 01Emblehope Moor
page.content: This is the title from the ordnance survey. A better one would be the Emblehope Amphhitheatre. Viewed from the south, there is an area of 7km W to E & 4km S to N, rough moorland with only two lonely farms. There is only one rough road in from the south passing the Comb & running through the forest. There is no road out on any other side & only one rough path to the north, otherwise both bogs & rocks have to be contented with. It is a magnificant sight on a fine door, but the farms must be the loneliest in England - only one is at present occupied. Many sheep & a few cattle are there, also the roe deer from the forest.
